question_text: What is the difference between grep and egrep?
correct_answer: grep: basic regular expressions; egrep: extended regular expressions (same as grep -E).

question_text: What is the difference between find and locate?
correct_answer: find: searches in real-time; locate: uses pre-built database (faster).

question_text: What is the difference between ps aux and ps -ef?
correct_answer: ps aux: BSD style (shows user); ps -ef: UNIX style (shows PPID).

question_text: What is the difference between kill and kill -9?
correct_answer: kill: sends TERM signal (15); kill -9: sends KILL signal (cannot be caught/ignored).

question_text: What is the difference between > and >>?
correct_answer: >: redirects/overwrites; >>: redirects/appends.

question_text: What is the difference between | and >?
correct_answer: |: pipes stdout to stdin; >: redirects stdout to file.

question_text: What is the difference between & and &&?
correct_answer: &: runs command in background; &&: runs second command only if first succeeds.

question_text: What is the difference between ; and &&?
correct_answer: ;: runs commands sequentially; &&: runs second only if first succeeds.

question_text: What is the difference between hard link and soft link?
correct_answer: hard link: same inode
explanation: cannot cross filesystems; soft link: separate inode

question_text: What is the difference between /bin and /usr/bin?
correct_answer: /bin: essential binaries for all users; /usr/bin: user binaries (non-essential).

question_text: What is the difference between /dev/null and /dev/zero?
correct_answer: /dev/null: discards data; /dev/zero: produces null bytes.

question_text: What is the difference between chmod 755 and 644?
correct_answer: 755: rwxr-xr-x (owner: all

question_text: What is the difference between chmod u+x and +x?
correct_answer: u+x: adds execute for user only; +x: adds execute for all (user

question_text: What is the difference between chown and chgrp?
correct_answer: chown: changes owner and/or group; chgrp: changes group only.

question_text: What is the difference between nohup and disown?
correct_answer: nohup: runs command immune to hangups; disown: removes job from shell job table.

question_text: What is the difference between fg and bg?
correct_answer: fg: brings job to foreground; bg: runs job in background.

question_text: What is the difference between top and htop?
correct_answer: top: basic process monitor; htop: enhanced with colors

question_text: What is the difference between nice and renice?
correct_answer: nice: sets priority for new process; renice: changes priority of existing process.

question_text: What is the difference between ps and pstree?
correct_answer: ps: shows process list; pstree: shows process tree (parent-child relationships).

question_text: What is the difference between ifconfig and ip?
correct_answer: ifconfig: deprecated (net-tools); ip: modern (iproute2).

question_text: What is the difference between netstat and ss?
correct_answer: netstat: deprecated; ss: faster

question_text: What is the difference between ping and traceroute?
correct_answer: ping: tests connectivity; traceroute: shows route path.

question_text: What is the difference between curl and wget?
correct_answer: curl: more features

question_text: What is the difference between scp and rsync?
correct_answer: scp: simple secure copy; rsync: faster

question_text: What is the difference between telnet and ssh?
correct_answer: telnet: unencrypted; ssh: encrypted

question_text: What is the difference between apt and apt-get?
correct_answer: apt: user-friendly

question_text: What is the difference between yum and dnf?
correct_answer: yum: older (Yellowdog Updater Modified); dnf: newer (Dandified YUM)

question_text: What is the difference between rpm and yum?
correct_answer: rpm: low-level package manager; yum: high-level

question_text: What is the difference between dpkg and apt?
correct_answer: dpkg: low-level package installer; apt: high-level

question_text: What is the difference between awk and sed?
correct_answer: awk: programming language for text processing; sed: stream editor for basic transformations.

question_text: What is the difference between cut and awk?
correct_answer: cut: simple column extraction; awk: complex field processing.

question_text: What is the difference between sort and uniq?
correct_answer: sort: sorts lines; uniq: removes adjacent duplicates.

question_text: What is the difference between head and tail?
correct_answer: head: shows first lines; tail: shows last lines.

question_text: What is the difference between cat and less?
correct_answer: cat: displays entire file; less: paginated viewing.

question_text: What is the difference between less and more?
correct_answer: less: can scroll backwards; more: forward only.

question_text: What is the difference between tee and >?
correct_answer: tee: sends to stdout and files; >: sends only to file.

question_text: What is the difference between df and du?
correct_answer: df: shows filesystem disk space; du: shows disk usage of files/directories.

question_text: What is the difference between fdisk and parted?
correct_answer: fdisk: MBR partitions (≤2TB); parted: GPT partitions (>2TB).

question_text: What is the difference between mount and umount?
correct_answer: mount: attaches filesystem; umount: detaches filesystem.

question_text: What is the difference between /dev/sda and /dev/sda1?
correct_answer: /dev/sda: whole disk; /dev/sda1: first partition on disk.

question_text: What is the difference between ext4 and xfs?
correct_answer: ext4: default for many Linux; xfs: better for large files

question_text: What is the difference between useradd and adduser?
correct_answer: useradd: low-level tool; adduser: interactive

question_text: What is the difference between passwd and chpasswd?
correct_answer: passwd: changes password interactively; chpasswd: batch password change.

question_text: What is the difference between /etc/passwd and /etc/shadow?
correct_answer: /etc/passwd: user info (no passwords); /etc/shadow: encrypted passwords.

question_text: What is the difference between su and sudo?
correct_answer: su: switches user (requires target user's password); sudo: runs command as root (requires user's sudo privileges).

question_text: What is the difference between sudo -i and sudo -s?
correct_answer: sudo -i: login shell (reads target user's profile); sudo -s: non-login shell.

question_text: What is the difference between tar and zip?
correct_answer: tar: archives only (can combine with gzip/bzip2); zip: archives and compresses.

question_text: What is the difference between gzip and bzip2?
correct_answer: gzip: faster

question_text: What is the difference between tar -z and tar -j?
correct_answer: tar -z: uses gzip compression; tar -j: uses bzip2 compression.

question_text: What is the difference between ln -s and ln?
correct_answer: ln -s: creates symbolic (soft) link; ln: creates hard link.

question_text: What is the difference between cp and mv?
correct_answer: cp: copies file; mv: moves/renames file.

question_text: What is the difference between rm and rmdir?
correct_answer: rm: removes files/directories; rmdir: removes empty directories only.

question_text: What is the difference between touch and cat >?
correct_answer: touch: creates empty file/updates timestamp; cat >: creates file with content.

question_text: What is the difference between which and whereis?
correct_answer: which: shows executable path; whereis: shows binary

question_text: What is the difference between alias and function?
correct_answer: alias: simple command substitution; function: can have parameters

question_text: What is the difference between source and .?
correct_answer: source: loads script into current shell; .: same as source (POSIX).

question_text: What is the difference between $? and $$?
correct_answer: $?: exit status of last command; $$: PID of current shell.

question_text: What is the difference between [ ] and [[ ]]?
correct_answer: [ ]: POSIX test command; [[ ]]: bash extension

question_text: What is the difference between $( ) and ` `?
correct_answer: $( ): modern command substitution; ` `: legacy backticks.

question_text: What is the difference between ${var} and $var?
correct_answer: ${var}: explicit variable expansion; $var: simple expansion.

question_text: What is the difference between export and set?
correct_answer: export: makes variable available to child processes; set: sets shell options/variables.

question_text: What is the difference between env and printenv?
correct_answer: env: runs command with modified environment; printenv: prints environment variables.

question_text: What is the difference between ulimit and sysctl?
correct_answer: ulimit: sets user process limits; sysctl: configures kernel parameters.

question_text: What is the difference between cron and anacron?
correct_answer: cron: runs at specific times; anacron: runs jobs missed during downtime.

question_text: What is the difference between at and cron?
correct_answer: at: runs job once at specified time; cron: runs jobs periodically.

question_text: What is the difference between systemctl and service?
correct_answer: systemctl: systemd service manager; service: SysV init compatibility.

question_text: What is the difference between journalctl and syslog?
correct_answer: journalctl: systemd journal; syslog: traditional logging system.

question_text: What is the difference between /var/log and /var/log/journal?
correct_answer: /var/log: traditional log directory; /var/log/journal: systemd journal binary logs.

question_text: What is the difference between lsof and fuser?
correct_answer: lsof: lists open files; fuser: identifies processes using files/directories.

question_text: What is the difference between strace and ltrace?
correct_answer: strace: traces system calls; ltrace: traces library calls.

question_text: What is the difference between /proc and /sys?
correct_answer: /proc: process and kernel info; /sys: device and driver info.

question_text: What is the difference between free and vmstat?
correct_answer: free: shows memory usage; vmstat: shows virtual memory statistics.

question_text: What is the difference between iostat and sar?
correct_answer: iostat: shows I/O statistics; sar: system activity report (historical).

question_text: What is the difference between uptime and w?
correct_answer: uptime: shows system uptime and load; w: shows logged-in users and their processes.

question_text: What is the difference between who and whoami?
correct_answer: who: shows logged-in users; whoami: shows current user.

question_text: What is the difference between groups and id?
correct_answer: groups: shows groups user belongs to; id: shows user/group IDs.

question_text: What is the difference between last and lastlog?
correct_answer: last: shows login history; lastlog: shows last login for all users.

question_text: What is the difference between /etc/fstab and /etc/mtab?
correct_answer: /etc/fstab: static filesystem table; /etc/mtab: dynamic mount table.

question_text: What is the difference between /tmp and /var/tmp?
correct_answer: /tmp: cleared on reboot; /var/tmp: preserved across reboots.

question_text: What is the difference between ldd and objdump?
correct_answer: ldd: shows shared library dependencies; objdump: displays object file info.

question_text: What is the difference between nm and strings?
correct_answer: nm: lists symbols from object files; strings: extracts printable strings.

question_text: What is the difference between file and stat?
correct_answer: file: determines file type; stat: displays file status/details.

question_text: What is the difference between wc -l and wc -w?
correct_answer: wc -l: counts lines; wc -w: counts words.

question_text: What is the difference between tr and sed?
correct_answer: tr: translates/deletes characters; sed: stream editor for complex transformations.

question_text: What is the difference between diff and cmp?
correct_answer: diff: shows differences between files; cmp: compares binary files.

question_text: What is the difference between patch and diff?
correct_answer: diff: creates patch file; patch: applies patch file.

question_text: What is the difference between watch and tail -f?
correct_answer: watch: runs command repeatedly; tail -f: follows file changes.

question_text: What is the difference between seq and jot?
correct_answer: seq: generates number sequences; jot: more features (random numbers

question_text: What is the difference between bc and expr?
correct_answer: bc: arbitrary precision calculator; expr: evaluates expressions.

question_text: What is the difference between time and /usr/bin/time?
correct_answer: time: shell builtin; /usr/bin/time: external command with more details.

question_text: What is the difference between shred and rm?
correct_answer: shred: overwrites file before deletion; rm: simply removes file pointer.

question_text: What is the difference between md5sum and sha256sum?
correct_answer: md5sum: MD5 hash; sha256sum: SHA-256 hash (more secure).

question_text: What is the difference between openssl and gpg?
correct_answer: openssl: toolkit for SSL/TLS; gpg: GNU Privacy Guard for encryption/signing.

question_text: What is the difference between iptables and firewalld?
correct_answer: iptables: low-level packet filtering; firewalld: dynamic firewall manager.

question_text: What is the difference between nslookup and dig?
correct_answer: nslookup: simple DNS lookup; dig: detailed DNS information.

question_text: What is the difference between host and nslookup?
correct_answer: host: simple DNS lookup; nslookup: interactive DNS query.

question_text: What is the difference between route and ip route?
correct_answer: route: deprecated routing tool; ip route: modern iproute2 command.

question_text: What is the difference between arp and ip neigh?
correct_answer: arp: ARP cache manipulation; ip neigh: modern neighbor discovery.

question_text: What is the difference between tcpdump and wireshark?
correct_answer: tcpdump: command-line packet analyzer; wireshark: GUI packet analyzer.

question_text: What is the difference between nc and telnet?
correct_answer: nc: netcat
explanation: Swiss army knife for TCP/UDP; telnet: TCP connection testing.

question_text: What is the difference between ssh-keygen and ssh-copy-id?
correct_answer: ssh-keygen: generates SSH keys; ssh-copy-id: copies public key to remote server.

question_text: What is the difference between /etc/ssh/ssh_config and ~/.ssh/config?
correct_answer: /etc/ssh/ssh_config: system-wide SSH config; ~/.ssh/config: user-specific SSH config.

question_text: What is the difference between screen and tmux?
correct_answer: screen: terminal multiplexer; tmux: modern alternative with better features.

question_text: What is the difference between history and fc?
correct_answer: history: shows command history; fc: fix command (edit/re-run history).

question_text: What is the difference between echo and printf?
correct_answer: echo: simple output; printf: formatted output.

question_text: What is the difference between read and readarray?
correct_answer: read: reads input into variable; readarray: reads input into array.

question_text: What is the difference between let and expr?
correct_answer: let: evaluates arithmetic expressions; expr: evaluates expressions (strings too).

question_text: What is the difference between trap and exit?
correct_answer: trap: handles signals; exit: terminates script with status.

question_text: What is the difference between exec and source?
correct_answer: exec: replaces current shell with command; source: runs script in current shell.

question_text: What is the difference between wait and sleep?
correct_answer: wait: waits for background jobs; sleep: pauses for specified time.

question_text: What is the difference between break and continue?
correct_answer: break: exits loop; continue: skips to next iteration.

question_text: What is the difference between shift and unset?
correct_answer: shift: shifts positional parameters; unset: removes variable.
